subject: Real Estate
title: Title Search: Uncovering Hidden Claims
description: A fast breakdown of Title Search: Uncovering Hidden Claims for builders.

hook.text: You buy a house. Six months later, a stranger shows up with a deed proving they own half of it.

buildup.text: A title search examines public records to verify the seller actually has the right to sell the property.

discovery.text: Searchers look for liens, unpaid taxes, boundary disputes, and previous transfers going back decades.

twist.text: In rare cases, title searches uncover forged deeds or missing heirs whose claims were never resolved.

climax.text: A clean title is the foundation of every real estate transaction. Without it, ownership is uncertain.

punchline.text: Never buy a home without knowing who truly owns it.

quiz.question: What does a title search verify?
options: That the seller has the legal right to sell
